Instruction: Once the lemon juice is added, reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes, stirring gently, until the milk begins to curdle.

Remove from heat and pour into a sieve lined with cheesecloth. Gather the cheesecloth by its four corners and tie them together. Hang the cheese in the cloth over the sink to allow it to drain for 30 minutes to 1 hour. After draining, place the cheese, still in the cloth, into a bowl and refrigerate until needed.
If you wish to cut the paneer into firm sticks later, use a spoon to press it into the shape of the bowl before refrigerating.
